title_en: A Judge Ordered The University Of California Academic Workers Union To Suspend The Strike
summary_en:
A state judge has ordered graduate students at the University of California to temporarily end a strike at six campuses.
The leadership of the University of California has won in a legal effort to force the strikers to return to work.
The strike began in response to the administration's crackdown on pro-Palestinian protests on the Los Angeles and Irvine campuses.
The union accused the university system of authorizing violent arrests and violating workers' right to peaceful protest.
The injunction orders graduate teachers and researchers to temporarily return to work.
The union accused UC of committing various unfair labor actions caused by its protest reaction.
The university system stated that the reasons for the strike were purely political and social in nature.
The graduate students insist that the fight is being waged for their right as employees to protest without fear of arrest or retaliation.
